messages.content: Yes, "pair of scissors" is a plural noun. It refers to two or more scissors together as a set or collection.
Isn't it a singular since it's just one thing?
Yes, "pair of scissors" is a singular noun because it refers to one thing, which is a pair of scissors.
So is "one pair of scissors" singular or plural?
"One pair of scissors" is singular because it refers to one instance of the noun "pair of scissors".
